summary: Provides the functionality required to hook into various events, register components and control the game loop.
remarks: The Engine class is used as the main entry point for a Pixel.js game. An example of how to hook into this can be found in the [Getting Started](/getting-started) guide.

properties.name: deltaTime
properties.description: The time in milliseconds that has passed since the last iteration of the game loop.

properties.name: displayFPS
properties.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the built-in FPS counter should be displayed.

properties.name: fullscreen
properties.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not fullscreen mode should be enabled.

properties.name: maxDeltaTime
properties.description: The maximum amount of time in milliseconds that should be applied when calculating the time between iterations of the game loop.

properties.name: scene
properties.description: An object that encapsulates information relating to the game scene.

methods.name: addSound
methods.description: Add a [Sound](/documentation/Sound) to the collection of registered [Sound](/documentation/Sound) components.

methods.name: loadAndRun
methods.description: Loads all registered components that have been prepared and then runs the game loop.

methods.name: loadScene
methods.description: Loads the prepared components in the layers that are contained within the current scene.

methods.name: loadSounds
methods.description: Loads the prepared sounds that are currently registered.

methods.name: on
methods.description: Hooks a function to the specified event.

platforms.names: Google Chrome, Mozilla FireFox, Internet Explorer 9+, Opera, Safari.
platforms.notes: In addition to these tested browsers, the Engine class is supported by any browser that supports the HTML5 canvas.
